intro: Astrapaea tiliifolia, commonly known as the tiliifolia astrapaea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
